titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the World War I Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Ruth Gay and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 09:58

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: An artificial collection of printed material, photographs, songs, reports, correspondence, diaries, and miscellanea of United States men, many with a Yale University connection, relating to World War I, 1914-1919.

langmaterial.language: The material is in English, French, German, and Italian.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The bulk of the printed material was transferred from the Edward House Papers. Other material has either been the gift of various donors or transferred from other collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World War I Collection (MS 754). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Edward M. House Papers, MS 466. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series and nine additions: I. Reports, Memoranda, and Printed Matter, 1914-1922. II. Personal Papers, 1914-1983.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The core of the material in this collection was originally assembled out of the files of the Colonel Edward M. House collection in Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library. It has been added to by subsequent gifts from various donors.

The collection consists of miscellaneous printed matter, photographs, songs, reports, and a small amount of correspondence and diaries of American men, chiefly with a Yale connection, describing their war experiences. Many of the printed items are official reports by the Belgian, British, French and German governments. Also included are special issues of illustrated magazines and memoirs of the war. Of the thirty-nine war songs in the collection, twenty-eight are in English and eleven are in French. These are in the form of sheet music and contain both lyrics and piano accompaniment. Among the reports are a history of the American military government in occupied Germany, 1918-1920 by Colonel I. L. Hunt, edited by Truman Smith, and a synopsis of the history of the European Service Division of the American Expeditionary Forces by Bryan F. Peters.

Photographs and maps marked with battle plans offer detailed information on the way the war was fought. Of particular interest is a nine-volume photographic account of the war prepared by the Section Photographique de l'Armée Française, aerial photographs of French territory showing battle lines, and two photograph albums assembled by M. G. H. Nettleton. German naval operations are illustrated with printed matter, broadsides, etchings showing naval battles and naval heroes, music and memorabilia.
For posters issued by France, Germany, Great Britain and the United States, see the War Poster Collection, MS 671.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of miscellaneous printed matter relating to German naval operations during World War I. Included are colored broadsides (in French and German) and etchings showing naval battles, government posters, music, prints of naval heroes, an album of cartoons, and a collection of thirty-three "Vivant" ribbons. Also in the series are selected issues of periodicals devoted to naval events. These are listed individually below.

Letter, Captain Walter Camp, Jr. to Robert E. Wald describing life on the front lines with the Allied Expeditionary Force

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This addition consists of a scrapbook, ca. 1916-1918, belonging to Amelia ("Amy") Leavitt Hill, documenting her trip to France and England. The scrapbook has been disassembled and the material separated into folders of letters, memorabilia, newspaper clippings, photographs, and postcards. Correspondence consists of telegrams and letters in English and French, some from French soldiers, regarding Hill's trip and describing their experiences in World War I. Other material relates to Hill's ocean voyage, her stay in Europe, and the progress of the war. There are also a few newspaper clippings from the post-war period.
